meanings.definition: A place or object associated with a martyr.
meanings.sent1: The small chapel became a martyry after the brave saint was buried there.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed relics that turned it into a martyry for the fallen heroes.
meanings.sent3: The old tree stump, where the legendary hero fell, was now a martyry for visitors to see.
meanings.sent4: The battlefield stood as a martyry to the soldiers who fought valiantly for their country.
meanings.sent5: The simple cross by the road was a martyry to the memory of the accident victim.

meanings.definition: To martyr or sacrifice oneself for a cause.
meanings.sent1: She was willing to martyry her own dreams to support her family.
meanings.sent2: He decided to martyry his time to help those in need during the crisis.
meanings.sent3: The superhero was ready to martyry his secret identity to save the city.
meanings.sent4: The brave soldier chose to martyry his safety to protect his comrades.
meanings.sent5: They were prepared to martyry their comfort for the greater good of the community.

meanings.sent1: The martyr's sacrifice was a true martyry of devotion to their beliefs.
meanings.sent2: The ceremony honored the martyry of those who gave their lives for freedom.
meanings.sent3: The play humorously depicted the exaggerated martyry of the main character.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to the cause was a martyry that inspired others to join the movement.
meanings.sent5: The painting captured the emotional martyry of the martyr's final moments.
